page.title: 09Fairford's Village Hall
page.content: Fairford used to have an{assembly } {hall}on the same site as the{Palmer {Hall.}The old assembly hall was in need of major repairs. A man called Colonel A. Palmer came to live in Fairford Park. He gave Fairford Hall to replace the old hut and to commemorate the silver jubilee of King George V in{1935.}The Palmer Hall is 11 metres wide and 24 metres long.They hold meetings,discos, rummage sales,dramatic productions and parties.There is a car park for about eight vehicles.There is a stage with a picture of Fairford on it. People can go under the stage where equipment is stored.There is a kitchen where refreshments can be produced. The hall contains three exits.
